summary: The bill, titled the Stop Government Abandonment and Placement Scandals Act of 2025 (or Stop GAPS Act of 2025), addresses the handling of unaccompanied alien children. It directs the Secretary of Homeland Security to amend regulations regarding sponsors for these children. The bill also tasks the Director of the Office of Refugee Resettlement with tracking unaccompanied children released from Department of Homeland Security custody who are in the US and involved in immigration proceedings, as well as working with states to find placement for them.
